reporter_caption.center: MATTER OF BUFFALO TRACTION COMPANY, 17 App. Div. 620 (1897)

caption.center: In the Matter of the Application of The Buffalo Traction Company for the
Appointment of Three Commissioners to Determine Whether its Railroad Ought
to be Constructed and Operated in East and West Utica Street.

court.center: Appellate Division of the Supreme Court of New York, Fourth Department.

opinion.opinion_text: Order appointing commissioners allowed and filed with clerk. All concurred, except Ward, J., dissenting upon the ground that, on the papers presented, the court has not jurisdiction to appoint commissioners.
